intro: Eriocaulon papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan flat sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Islands, including Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in coastal areas or freshwater wetlands. Eriocaulon papuanum has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its ecological niche.
